content.text:
# 1969 Country Music Association Awards

The 1969 Country Music Association Awards, 3rd Ceremony, was held on October 15, 1969, at the Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, Tennessee, and was hosted by Dale Evans and Roy Rogers.
Winners and nominees
Winners in Bold.
{| class="wikitable"
! style="background:#EEDD85; width=50%" |Entertainer of the Year
! style="background:#EEDD85; width=50%" |Album of the Year
|-
| valign="top" |
* Johnny Cash
** Glen Campbell
** Roy Clark
** Merle Haggard
** Charley Pride
| valign="top" |
* 'At San Quentin — Johnny Cash'
** Charley Pride in Person — Charley Pride
** Same Train, a Different Time — Merle Haggard
** Stand by Your Man — Tammy Wynette
** Wichita Lineman — Glen Campbell
|-

! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Female Vocalist of the Year

| valign="top" |

** Dolly Parton

** "All I Have to Offer You (Is Me)" — Charley Pride

| valign="top" |
